channel.title: xarchiver fails to unpack archive
channel.description:
Is there a better archive software? I have no problems in tails with unpacking archives. Multipart password protected archive, checksum verified. No password is requested by archiver upon opening unlike tails archive manager.
Error report:
7-Zip [64] 16.02 : Copyright (c) 1999-2016 Igor Pavlov : 2016-05-21 p7zip Version 16.02 (locale=en_US.UTF-8,Utf16=on,HugeFiles=on,64 bits,3 CPUs Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-6500 CPU @ 3.20GHz (506E3),ASM,AES-NI)
Scanning the drive for archives: 1 file, 349175808 bytes (333 MiB)
Listing archive: /home/user/TB_Downloads/F.7z.001
Enter password (will not be echoed):-- Path = /home/user/TB_Downloads/F.7z.001 Type = Split Physical Size = 349175808 Volumes = 4 Total Physical Size = 1392836867
Date Time Attr Size Compressed Name ------------------- ----- ------------ ------------ ------------------------ ..... 1392836867 1392836867 F.7z ------------------- ----- ------------ ------------ ------------------------ 1392836867 1392836867 1 files ---------- Path = F.7z Open ERROR: Can not open the file as [7z] archive
------------------- ----- ------------ ------------ ------------------------ 1392836867 1392836867 1 files
Archives: 1 Volumes: 4 Total archives size: 1392836867
Errors: 1

item.title: xarchiver fails to unpack archive
item.dc:creator: tacoman
item.description:
Is there a better archive software? I have no problems in tails with unpacking archives. Multipart password protected archive, checksum verified. No password is requested by archiver upon opening unlike tails archive manager.

Error report:

7-Zip [64] 16.02 : Copyright © 1999-2016 Igor Pavlov : 2016-05-21
p7zip Version 16.02 (locale=en_US.UTF-8,Utf16=on,HugeFiles=on,64 bits,3 CPUs Intel® Core™ i5-6500 CPU @ 3.20GHz (506E3),ASM,AES-NI)

Scanning the drive for archives:
1 file, 349175808 bytes (333 MiB)

Listing archive: /home/user/TB_Downloads/F.7z.001
